column4: when I run apt-get update. I'm getting for "Failed to fetch" ... 404 not found. Any reason for concern?
*for = four*
try a local mirror
I give you the same advice I gave you 6 hours ago: use a local mirror
in software sources, you can change your repository server to a local one
affirmative
when you say local mirror. you mean choose a download server I think it closest to me?
yes
asking you bc you helped before. I've chosen multiple servers and am getting "404 not found" on not all but a few of the packages.
have you run « sudo apt-get update »
pastebin your errors (and the command you ran to get them).  Include a « sudo apt-get update » ifrst
do I just paste the "pastebin' embed code?
just the url
http://pastebin.com/8yvnRHsS
those are just PPAs that don't have quantal; you should disable them
disable in software sources?
or I
sure, you can disable in software sources
appreciate all your help
